Reviews.Title: “How do you choose a hotel in Paris?”
Reviews.Author: AlanRamsay
Reviews.Content: By personal recommendation, perhaps. The Hotel Delambre was recommended to us, and we'd like to recommend it to you. The hotel is bright, attractive and friendly. The owner/manager was able to welcome me by name when I arrived, and greeted me by name throughout our three days there. A nice touch. The rooms are clean, the bed was comfortable, the shower worked ... All you'd really want in a city centre hotel. The situation, too, is excellent. In a little one-way street full of small restaurants, delicatessens, a locksmith and a laundry. It's a place where people live and go about their business. Minutes from the Gare Montparnasse, the Boulevard Montparnasse and the Vavin metro station (on Ligne 4.) Our one little giggle was the breakfast. By the time we arrived, cups and bowls were in short supply and the waitress hadn't yet refilled the buffet. But not a problem: we took breakfast in a nearby cafe on the following mornings. We'll certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely start to our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: gessicaj
Reviews.Content: Paris was our first stop on our 4 city 2 country honeymoon trip. We spent 4 nights in Paris and Hotel Delambre was a nice way to get things started. When we got there (a few hours early), the receptionist greeted us with a smile and helped us store our bags away until check-in time. She was very personable! She gave us a map of the city and made note of some great palces to visit. She pointed out where we were on the map and the best way to get around the city. Finally when it was time to check in, she took down our information and gave us our key and we hopped onto the small elevator and made our way to our room. The room was a bit small but it was clean and charming. The bathroom seemed like it had been recentluy updated. It was equipped with a/c, TV but unfortunately no mini bar. We were hoping for a small fridge so that we could store some of the store bought food that we had. The hotel's within walking distance of a few supermarkets, several restaurants and cafe's and a shopping mall. The 2 subway stations located a stones throw away make it even easier to get around the city though I'd recommend walking to your destinations as its a lovely scenic way to get to see the city and take in its beauty. All in all, this was a charming introduction to our european honeymoon and we'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, well-located”
Reviews.Author: judybarnes
Reviews.Content: The staff people were helpful, the entire hotel is clean and attractive, there's a lift, the rooms are large (for Paris) and bright, the location not our first choice but very good. Getting coffee in the hotel was cheaper and better than going out for it, especially since you can get refills. We were four people in two rooms, and all glad we stayed here. At either end of the street is a metro station so we could get anywhere we wanted to go easily. There are two grocery stores near the hotel and the restaurants across the street are good if you're too tired to wander. Watch out for the bakeries though; I got the worst croissants I've ever had at one of them, but I don't recall which. My sister concurred, and into the trash they went! All in all, the Hotel Delambre is a great value for Paris and a pleasant place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: NarbMom19072
Reviews.Content: Quaint Hotel - kind attentive staff. Near Montparnasse Train station and many metro stops but best of all just around the corner from Rue du Montparnasse filled with creperies including the best - Crêperie Josselin!! Half mile walk through the left bank takes you to the Louvre or Deux Magots cafe. This had an elevator for my handicapped mother.

Reviews.Title: “Great quaint hotel and excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Sammytay
Reviews.Content: We researched a lot of 3 star hotels on tripadvisor before deciding on hotel delambre and were glad that we stayed there. Its a quaint little hotel at a very arty and central part of paris - montparnesse. We travelled with a 1 year old as well and they provided a cot in the room and it was a very comfy stay for a week. The rooms were clean, simple and spacious enough for a european 3 star hotel. The lifts were tiny but worked well and the staff very friendly - almost a mom and pop type operation. The price as well was very reasonable for paris compared to other hotels in the same category and the location was fantastic - it was a short walk to the main train station and there was another subway stop around the corner. There were also daily markets around the corner and plenty of restaurants and a supermarket nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home in Paris”
Reviews.Author: houston63
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Hotel Delambre always had a smile and happy "bonjour", from the minute we walked in, we were made to feel at home. The hotel is more than comfortable and good size superior rooms with a balcony overlooking rue delambre.It's location is close to everything and steps away from bakery,grocer,pharmacy,laundromat,and tons of restaurants..and a metro line at each end of this true parisian neighborhood street.We would stay here again in a second!!!

Reviews.Title: “Paris Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: researchguy
Reviews.Content: Returned from four night stay, 23 September-27 September, 2011. We have stayed here on previous trips and elected to come back. The front desk staff is very friendly and always very helpful, including speaking English. While my French is decent, they do not hesitate with English which is, of course, useful when my vocabulary dries up. On this trip, once again, we had a room facing to the street. Friday night it was quite festive on the street until the wee hours. With the window open it was loud. However, thankfully, the AC was still operational so we closed up the window and it was very quiet. On previous trips in February, street noise is not an issue. While the rooms themselves are a bit of a squeeze for two people, we have found them just fine, functional and clean. The wireless service is fine in the room and quite the bargain at 5euros for the entire stay! Within five minutes walk you will find tons of cafes, restaurants and bistros. The Edgar Quinet metro is all of a 90 second walk, Vavin four minutes. If coming in by RER from CDG, you can take too Denfert and connect on the metro to Quinet. It is very handy. All things considered, this hotel has served us very well and I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Lacks good customer service, unreasonable staff”
Reviews.Author: onlytraveling
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a long trip in Europe (Germany, France, Belgium & Holand) which included three days in Paris. We we stayed only two nights at this hotel. The hotel is well located in the city and accommodations were comfortable. However, it lacks good customer service. Upon arrival, the check in employee failed to assist us with the luggage and was unsure as to where exactly our room was in the building ("between the 4th or 5th floor...") The hotel staff did not describe the particularities of the services offered at the hotel, and was unreasonable and unfamiliar with the hotel management functions in the resolution of issues, such as the one that arose during our stay. The reasonable prices for the rooms for a 3 star hotel influenced our decision to stay here, considering our short stay. But it seems that the price is THE catch, and that the management uses any excuse to make extra money from their guests. The hotel offers WiFi at an extra cost, which we paid. They gave us a small strip of paper with the password and we were not warned by the staff that if it gets lost we would have to pay double for the same service. However, we kept the little strip of paper with the "secret" password on a table in the room and left for a walk. When we returned it was gone! Apparently it was trashed during the hotel cleaning service. We explained exactly what happened to the reception employee. He was less than accommodating, was unreasonable, and unwilling to provide any customer satisfaction resolution. He said he was "just an employee there" and that was forced by the management to charge us again. He suggested that we talk to the management the next day. The next morning we left without being able to meet with the manager to resolve the issue. The experience left us with a bitter taste of what should be considered a 3 star hotel, and though the price for the service is affordable, the real issue remains on the principle of serving us well and fairly as their guests. By the quality of service received we would have thought this is a two star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay in a Cool Neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: moose905
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 4 nights at Hotel Delambre in mid July, and really enjoyed our stay. We had a superior double room - spacious, clean, nicely decorated room, decent bed, full bathroom with tub and shower. Air condtioned rooms, so it was always at a comfortable temperature. Wifi available at a very reasonable price - 5 euro for the entire stay. Staff are friendly and can help you out in English if you need that. Many restaurants and cafes nearby in Montparnasse, and the hotel is half a block away from the Edgar Quinet metro stop - very convenient to get around. A great base for exploring Paris. A solid 3 star, at good value for Paris. We had looked at several other places online prior to booking, and walked past all of them at some point during our stay, and remained very pleased with our choice. Cons - the bed had an old fashioned bedspread - a comforter would have been nicer. No coffee/tea in the room, or iron.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in a great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: samota_montreal
Reviews.Content: I paid 100 euros for a double room in January 2011. The room was pretty small, but is in the average for that class of hotel in Paris. The hotel kept its old style, but everything is well maintained and clean. There is an electric heater is the room and it could remove all the humidity and the cold temperature in the room easily. The location of the hotel is great and there are a lot of cafes and restaurants in the neighborhood. There are also metro stations from different lines near the hotel. Montparnasse is a great neighborhood to stay if you want to feel the Parisian life. The staff from the hotel was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast is not included with the room rates, but a continental breakfast is served in the lobby for less than 10 euros. You can buy an access for wifi, but on the third floor, I had problems to connect to major websites. I decided to stop paying and to connect to an unsecured wifi available, which was faster than the one from the hotel. Overall, I would recommand that hotel for its good value and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: Shelneen
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Paris with 3 friends (4 Canadian adults from Toronto total). It was the first time to Paris for us all, and we wanted something with privacy (separate rooms), clean, in a safe and interesting area, and at a reasonable cost. The online search was exhausting as we found problems listed with one hotel after another, or with prices more than we were willing to pay. Finally a colleague of mine who just returned from Paris recommeded the Hotel Delambre. We were impressed with the look of it on their website, and received prompt and courteous responses from the hotel, which was in a great area (Montparnasse). Rooms were very reasonably priced. We couldn't have asked for a better hotel stay. Our conceirge, Jean Paul, was wonderful - so pleasant and helpful - he really made our stay extremely pleasant. The hotel itself was very nicely decorated, very clean beyond a fault, and in such a convenient area - a few minutes walking distance to 2 Metro lines, and right in the heart of a lively bistro area frequented by hip locals who live and socialize there. We felt immediately at home, safe and comfortable. Just down the street was a Saturday morning farmer's market, a wine shop, cheese shop, and bakery. We were in heaven! In fact we loved the place so much, I promised to take the time from my busy schedule to post this rave review so that others can benefit from our good fortune. Thank you Jean Paul and the Hotel Delambre for making our trip to Paris perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: RozAus
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I have just finished a brilliant two night stay here. We came there after a 36 hour trip from Sydney, Australia and were treated brilliantly. The reception team let us keep our bikes on the ground floor which was very thoughtful as they would have taken up most of our room. Which is to say tha the rooms are euro size, read small, but pleasant and very clean. I haven't been to Paris since I was a child and my wife had never been. We also do not speak French, although we try, badly. The staff all speak fluent English which is a great help. Just down the street (eitheir way) are plenty of cafes etc. The Metro is approx 100m away and connects to all major attractions with a few changes, again very easy. Breakfast can be had downstairs each day also which is pretty good. To sum up the hotel in a few words: great location and staff!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean and Cozy. Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: druesome
Reviews.Content: I didn't like the apartment that my travel companions booked for our stay in Paris, so I decided to look for a reasonably price hotel on the same street -- Rue Delambre. Hotel Delambre was tucked near the end of the street. Its lovely, aqua-colored window frames were pretty hard to miss. The nice concierge placed me on the 4th floor. I was surprised by how spacious my room was. Bed was queen sized, bath was roomy and there was even space for me to place my laptop and surf the Internet, which cost me an extra 5 euros for 4 days. I had a great view of the street and nearby buildings. There really isn't much to complain about Hotel Delambre, except on the last day when I had to leave! I would recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to travel to Paris and wouldn't mind spending a few more euros for comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel in a great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: kristenb731
Reviews.Content: Not knowing much about the neighborhoods of Paris, we didn't know what to expect when we booked this hotel in the middle of the Montparnasse district, but the location was perfect - accessible to multiple train stations including the Gare Montparnasse, and close to alot of great restaurants and sites (the Montparnasse tower is just a few blocks away, and the Luxembourg Gardens and Catacombs are very close as well), while also in a safe area. It's a little bit further from the main attractions - about a 25-30 minute walk to both the Eiffel Tower & the Louvre, but on a nice day the walk doesn't seem so bad, as you're walking through some beautiful areas of Paris. The rooms were spacious and clean, and the staff was extremely helpful and friendly. I would definitely come back to this hotel the next time I visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable in old style with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: VeronicaGB
Reviews.Content: Very nice and helpful staff. Beautiful lobby, breakfast room and bedrooms, nicely decorated in old style. Clean and comfortable. Good breakfast, but slow service one out of three mornings. Close to Montparnasse train station and several Metro stations. Nice surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Highest Recommendation”
Reviews.Author: daugereau7
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. My friends and I had booked five rooms. We were all pleased with our rooms. They were very clean and spacious. The air conditioner cooled the room very quickly. Everything looked new. Most of us had very nice street views from our windows. The desk staff spoke enough English to communicate clearly. The breakfast had various delicious items, including boiled eggs. The Montparnesse Tower, Montparnesse Cemetery, and the Catacombs were just a few blocks away. Although it is on a busy street, it is very quiet at night.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay at the Delambre again, great value for the money.”
Reviews.Author: Gloriaap
Reviews.Content: We would stay at the Delambre again. It had an elevator and air conditioning and a great location. This is a great value for the money. The Metro was just half a block away and the neighborhood was a delight. There were actually Parisians not just tourists in the restaurants. A little short on shopping in the area but they had great street vendors about every other day. The rooms are small but not small for European cities, clean with a nice staff. There was a Starbucks around the corner with free wifi access and the hotel had internet for a price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: NewmarketWally
Reviews.Content: Paris certainly has no shortage of hotels and options for the traveller and it all comes down to value for your money. A hotel is for sleeping and one should not waste time in a hotel and paying high prices. A beautiful city like Paris involves being out of the hotel and exploring. We found a great clean and charming hotel in Montparnasse called the hotel DeLambre. The staff couldn't be more helpful and we were treated like family. No question we will return again and look forward to our "home away from home". Clifford & Sandy Smith Toronto Canada

Reviews.Title: “Comfort, Convenience, Reasonable Rates”
Reviews.Author: Sharmyn
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with the service, the comfort, the convenience of the room. The internet wi-fi access was not complimentary, but it was available and reliable. The staff was pleasant and helpful. The hotel is within a block of two Metro stations, making it a splendid launch-point for our sight-seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Ideal Place!”
Reviews.Author: MatzoBrawl
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel - near three different metro lines, 2 blocks from Gare Montparnasse (so it was so easy to catch the RGR the day we went to Versailles, and the TGV when we went south to continue our trip). Totally charming, clean, the people were nice. We thought the continental breakfast for an additional 11 euro was too pricey, so we found breakfast elsewhere. Great neighborhood, really great not touristy restaurants all around, a fabulous open air market on the weekends. We had one little snafu at check-in, we had reserved the family suite, but it was apparently double booked. They weren't upfront about why when we checked in, but they did give us 2 connecting rooms for the same price which was just as good if not better because we had 2 bathrooms. Overall, we were extremely satisfied and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Value for Paris Lovers”
Reviews.Author: davequ
Reviews.Content: I usually rent apartments when I stay in Paris, but when I want a hotel, this is usually my first choice. Besides the good rooms and pleasant & helpful staff, one of the main reasons is the reasonable price, consistently in the 90 EU range (~$115/night for 3+ night stays). For what you get, (pleasant Paris 3-star comfort) that is an excellent price. Good-sized (for Paris) rooms, very clean, well-decorated. The location is outstanding for a Paris veteran who is familiar with the Metro, and is not on their first trip with a necessity to be staying right next to (e.g) the Louvre, Champs Elysees, or Notre Dame. Hotel Delambre's Montparnasse location in the quieter 14th has lots of hidden history, excellent cafes for people-watching, great food (Dome, Coupole, etc), and some terrific historic walks. With Vavin, Edgar Quinet, and the huge hub Montparnasse Bienvenue Metro stops close-by an experienced "metro-rat" like me can get anywhere in Paris in just minutes - even CDG airport quickly on the RER-B at nearby Pl Denfert Rochereau - while at the same time escaping some of the millions of international tourists clogging the Disneyland-like and more expensive theater setting that sometimes is central Paris during high season. Montparnasse is not necessarily for the Paris "virgin" tourist that is here for the first time to see the Mona Lisa - it is more for the Paris-lover / veteran traveler who wants instead to get more of a feeling of what the "real" (if there is such a thing) Paris is like now, yet be right in the middle of Paris history in the art and cafe "crazy years" of the early 20th century. Hotel Delambre's staff speaks English, is very helpful with suggestions, reservations, etc. and there is a night clerk on duty to buzz when you come crawling in at 4am. Good petite dejeuner in the lobby but I always skip it and hit one of the cafes nearby like Select on Blvd Montparnasse or Cafe de la Place/Bistro Petit Rotonde up the street at Pl Fernand Mourlot so I can relax on a terrace and people- watch. Read up on Kiki (Alice Prin), Henry Miller, Picasso and the Montparnasse Cafe society of the '20s, book a nice room at Hotel Delambre, and enjoy Paris in a different, more intimate way. Highly recommended. I have more about Delambre, Montparnasse, and Paris here if you are interested: > http://members.virtualtourist.com/m/48d21/18308/3/

Reviews.Title: “charm hotel”
Reviews.Author: TELLY93
Reviews.Content: I was in Paris, last january with a friend, and we decide find the hotel there. We saw some webs about destination and some place interesting to stay like Montmantre. We just need a nice, comfortable and good pricing to stay. We paid Euros 95 with for a twim room, with bathroom. The staff at the hotel was very kind. If a very good option to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Value - Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: RueDePassyParis
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to Paris for 20+ years, and this hotel is outstanding. The value for the price paid is incredible. The rooms are generous by Paris standards and immaculate. The staff at the hotel are the friendliest in all of Paris. I have read the reviews of people who complained about the location. It is true that it is not in the middle of the Latin quarter or 5 minutes from the Eiffel Tower -- but it is in an incredibly central part of Paris - a 5 minute walk to 2 different metro lines - and a 2 minute walk to some of the best (non-touristy) cafes and restaurants in Paris. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “grt plc!!”
Reviews.Author: ctsh
Reviews.Content: this is a grt lil hotel at a fantastic price!! we stayed in the suite (which is actually the attic with another small rm attached) which is big enough for 4 adults and 1 child. the room is clean, hotel well located as its just 2 min away fm a metro. it is relatively safe to walk back to the hotel at night as it is located right in the midst of all the restuarants. dont misunderstand, it is definately not a noisy plc! we will definately stay at this hotel again n recommend evryone else to it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: sarphil
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 stints of 2 nights (with a break elsewhere in between) for the Rugby World Cup. This is a nice little hotel, basic but clean and with very friendly staff. The location is very good - there are lots of restaurants and bars in the vicinity including some of the famous Left Bank Cafes of old, such as La Coupole. There are 3 Metro stations in close proximity - Vavin, Edgar Quinet and Montparnasse. I was surprised to see another reviewer say the location was not good - all the sites in Paris are accessible from here by Metro, RER and bus. You could not possibly stay in a hotel that is near everything! I would recommend this hotel for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but if you are three avoid it!”
Reviews.Author: Thaïs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Delambre twice last july. The first experience was a nice one as we stayed at the mini suite ( we were four, me, my husband and my two sons) which accomodates four people easily. As other customers already said in this site the mini suite is in fact two good sized rooms connected, a bathroom (with no curtains in the bathtub and shower!). There is no fridge which can be considered a problem to those like us that decided not to have breakfast at the hotel. Anyway not a big problem that would make us give up staying at this good and well located hotel. The second experience was not that nice as we were only three this time (my husband went back home before us). When I booked the hotel I asked for a triple, they told me that it would cost me 107 euros. So I figured that they had a triple room. But that was not the case at all!! When we arrived back to the hotel we received a double room with a spare bed, it wouldn't be a problem if the room could accomodate it easily, which was not the case at all!!! The spare bed stayed between the table we used to eat and the other bed, it was almost impossible to pass from one part of the room to another and every morning I had to push the bed to one side, almost putting it out of the room (it would stay very near the door) in order to have breakfast. I understand that the hotel should have told me at the time of the booking that they did not have a triple room, in this case I would have searched for another hotel with a triple room for the second stay. So If you are travelling in a group of three avoid staying in Delambre. If not I consider the delambre a good choice, in spite of not having fridges.

Reviews.Title: “Room 7 - very nice”
Reviews.Author: hobbit_baggins
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us by some friends who often come to Paris to visit family. The hotel is pleasant and quiet and no suprises for a 3-star Paris hotel. Prices are correct and breakfast was standard and served nicely. The hotel staff were very friendly with that owner-behind-the-desk feel. The location is excellent with easy access to the Vavin metro station or about 10 minutes walk to the Jardins de Luxembourg. There are lots of places to eat along the Blvd Montparnasse and, if you like exploring, you can also walk into what was the old village of Montparnasse and find restaurants and bars there too. Room 7 was very nice. It is perched on the rooftops in the courtyard behind the hotel and accessible via a covered terrace. You can sit out on the terrace if you like. It is about normal Paris 3* room size with a spaceous bathroom. The room was quiet and airy and we slept very well. HBB

Reviews.Title: “Excellent !!!”
Reviews.Author: jonjertal
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed at the Delambre Hotel for 2 nights in a mini suite which comfortably accommodated my 2 teenage children and my wife and I. The suite consists of two good size bedrooms, each with its own TV. As the suite is in the attic, it has a bit of charm but room height is limited, we had no problems. The staff were very good, friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a very nice part of Paris and within easy walking to airport connection, either train or the Air France shuttle bus. EXCELLENT HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Would Try to find something better”
Reviews.Author: gold_nut
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Delambre in Paris for 3 days at the end of December and would not stay again, even if we had to pay more. On the positive side, the Hotel is convenient to the Edgar Quinet metro, but it is rather removed from the main attracts of Paris. There was really nothing to do around the hotel, at least for us. For two people it was 105 E, which I guess is not too bad for Paris but our room was laughably small. The door almost hit the bed when you opened it. Despite leaving a do not disturb sign on the door each day we were there, the housekeeping ignored it and cleaned the room anyway. Also the bed we had was incredibly uncomfortable. We both had difficult sleeping and my fiancee felt sore the next morning. Our worst experience was one night when we could hear the "amorous activities" of one of our neighbors. Granted, this is really not the hotel's fault, but it gives you an idea of how thin the walls are. If noise bothers you, find somewhere else. The room was pretty clean, as well as the bathroom. I would try to find something more centrally located and nicer, even if I had to pay a little more.

Reviews.Title: “Basic budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: My2sentsworth
Reviews.Content: This hotel is billed as a three star hotel, however, it just a basic budget hotel. The manager was charming and very helpful. Our room was extremely small, but clean and satisfactory, and for $90 euros a night very defintely a smart stay since we spent only sleeping time in the room. Breakfast is $9 euros extra and not worth it, very sparce. We went to the Starbucks a few blocks away. The area, has few main attractions, but wonderful little creperies. Travel by metro (which is great) or by bus to other areas is essential.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small room but with a balcony!”
Reviews.Author: byoung3rd
Reviews.Content: We loved the Delambre...we had a room with a small balcony overlooking Rue Delambre....it was noisy at night, but what do you expect...its Paris! Food was good, room was clean and nice (a little small but not out of the ordinary)...staff was very helpful. I have recommended this hotel to others who also found it to be comfortable and convenient. The neighborhood has history and charm (I could list all of the writers and artists who have called this neighborhood home...but the list would go on and on). After a full day walking and traveling around the city, just sitting on the balcony with a glass of wine some fresh bread, cheese and fruit...it just doesn't get any better! With metro stops at either end of rue Delambre (the street is only 2 blocks long) you can get almost anywhere in the city in minutes (metro stops Vavin and Edgar-Quinet).

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Delambre”
Reviews.Author: joseph105
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned February 19, 2006 from an 8 night stay at Hotel Delambre. What a great hotel. Staff at all times were helpful and very friendly. The staff at the desk spoke English very well. They made reservations for us and could not help us enough. The room was very clean and adequate space. Our room faced the street and we loved to look out the window at our surroundings. Fresh towels everyday and room cleaned. After one shower I was able not to get water all over the floor. You could fit two people very well in the bathroom. We had breakfast everyday at the hotel. It was a good breakfast. They did charge for the breakfast (8 Euros) but we left early everyday and did not take advantage of the pastry shopes on the street. There are so many good restaurants and shops that are within walking distance. Two different Metro lines that are about 2 minutes away. I would go back to this hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Delambre
HotelInfo.Address: 35, rue Delambre | 14 Arr., 75014 Paris, France
